plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: A tall annual plant known for its large, bright yellow composite flowers with a dark central disc. It turns to follow the sun and is widely cultivated for seeds and oil.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, native to North America
plants.funFact: Sunflowers exhibit heliotropism, where their flower heads track the sun across the sky during the day.

plants.name: Lilium bulbiferum
plants.description: A striking perennial lily with bright orange flowers often with dark spots. It thrives in meadows and mountain slopes in Europe.
plants.funFact: The orange lily has bulbils in leaf axils which help the plant propagate vegetatively.

plants.name: Protea cynaroides
plants.description: South Africa's national flower, this protea has a large, rounded inflorescence resembling an artichoke with pink and cream colored bracts.
plants.funFact: Proteas are pollinated by birds and are well adapted to the nutrient-poor soils of fynbos vegetation.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub or small tree with large, trumpet-shaped flowers in various colors, often red, thriving in warm climates worldwide.
plants.bloomingSeason: All year in tropical climates, including August
plants.funFact: The hibiscus flower is the national flower of Malaysia and is used symbolically in many cultures.
